com.jpaulmorrison.fbp.core.engine

Interface InputPort

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnArray, Connection, InitializationConnection

    public interface InputPort
    This class is used within components to declare instance variables that hold input ports. Such instance variables should be assigned within the openPorts routine of the component and never changed thereafter. Packets can be received, and the status of the port manipulated, using the API specified by this interface.

    InputPort is not a class, but an interface which is implemented either by a Connection object or by an InitializationConnection object.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
        Close Connection

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()

      • receive

        Packet receive()
        Receive the next available packet from this InputPort. The thread is suspended if no packets are currently available. At the end of input (when all upstream threads have closed their connected OutputPorts), null is returned.
        Returns:
        next packet, null if none

      • setType

        void setType(java.lang.Class type)
        Specify the type of packet content that will be accepted from this InputPort. Specifying null is equivalent to specifying Object.class -- in other words, any packet content is acceptable.
        Parameters:
        type - the class of acceptable packet content

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        string containing port name

      • getPort

        Port getPort()
        Returns:
        Port object

        Parameters:
